5637141661331522167.Text: Yes? Do you wish to turn in your certificate?

263261158930515852.Text: It's a way to offset the cost of establishing and developing the colony. Each employee is issued a certificate that has a value based on how well the colony is performing. If you decide you'd like to exchange it for money, it can be arranged. See me if you're interested in doing so.

22692151271352827070.Text: You've already turned in your certificate.

2101613772071230600.Text: Yes, well, you'll have to actually have the certificate in your posession for me to exchange it.

71064951032330875.Text: Very well. I'll just take the certificate, and this is yours.

2304213722098810832.Text: Yes, well. Given the absence of Carnius, I suppose I could process the appropriate paperwork. Would you like to exchange your certificate now?

15859310892244830074.Text: Yes, well. Given the absence of Carnius, I suppose I could process the appropriate paperwork. Would you like to exchange your certificate now?

302261996315917917.Text: Ah. Yes, well, Carnius handles stock certificates, being the local Factor and all.

46529115280773827.Text: Ah. Yes, well, Carnius handles stock certificates, being the local Factor and all.

2798616623261320300.Text: Didn't you already exchange it? You're not going to get another one, you know.

159489356292321038.Text: Hmm. Carnius would've been the one to deal with it, but he's not really in a position to do that, now is he? I imagine Constans Atrius can take care of it. Check with him at the fort.

1853728644312343192.Text: Hmm. Carnius would've been the one to deal with it, but he's not really in a position to do that, now is he? And Constans is dead as well, so I guess there's nothing that can be done with it. Pity.... perhaps you could have it framed.

4670228121711331300.Text: You'll have to take it to Carnius if you want to exchange it. He's the only one with the power to do that.

2169521913320828491.Text: Carnius was the only one with the power to redeem those certificates. I'm afraid it's useless without him.
